metadata.subject: Mathematics
metadata.curriculumSubtopic: Converting time (including milliseconds) and volume units with real-world applications

questions.question: Convert 3000 milliseconds to seconds.
questions.explanation: To convert milliseconds to seconds, divide by 1000. 3000 ÷ 1000 = 3 seconds.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Time conversions with milliseconds metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Convert 3000 milliseconds to seconds. Time conversion: 3 seconds.

questions.question: How many minutes are in 2.5 hours?
questions.explanation: To convert hours to minutes, multiply by 60. 2.5 × 60 = 150 minutes. This is useful for timing activities and filling bottles or containers.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Time conversions hours to minutes metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Convert 2.5 hours to minutes. Time conversion: 150 minutes.

questions.question: Convert 90 seconds to minutes.
questions.explanation: To convert seconds to minutes, divide by 60. 90 ÷ 60 = 1.5 minutes.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Time conversions seconds to minutes metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Convert 90 seconds to minutes. Time conversion: 1.5 minutes.

questions.question: Convert 4.5 litres to millilitres.
questions.explanation: To convert litres to millilitres, multiply by 1000. 4.5 × 1000 = 4500 mL.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Volume conversions litres to millilitres metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Convert 4.5 litres to millilitres. Volume conversion: 4500 mL.

questions.question: How many millilitres are in 2.3 litres? (Common for measuring in metres and millilitres)
questions.explanation: To convert litres to millilitres, multiply by 1000. 2.3 × 1000 = 2300 mL.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Volume conversions litres to millilitres metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Convert 2.3 litres to millilitres. Volume conversion: 2300 mL.

questions.question: Convert 0.5 cubic metres to litres. (Standard measurement in metres)
questions.explanation: To convert cubic metres to litres, multiply by 1000. 0.5 × 1000 = 500 litres.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Volume conversions cubic metres to litres metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Convert 0.5 cubic metres to litres. Volume conversion: 500 L.

questions.question: How many litres are in 2.5 m³?
questions.explanation: To convert cubic metres (m³) to litres, multiply by 1000. 2.5 × 1000 = 2500 litres.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Volume conversions cubic metres to litres metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Convert 2.5 m³ to litres. Volume conversion: 2500 L.

questions.question: Convert 1.5 gallons to litres. (1 gallon = 3.785 litres)
questions.explanation: To convert gallons to litres, multiply by 3.785. 1.5 × 3.785 = 5.6775 ≈ 5.68 litres.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Imperial to metric volume conversions
questions.contentForEmbedding: Convert 1.5 gallons to litres. Imperial conversion: 5.68 L.

questions.question: A movie is 2 hours and 45 minutes long. How many seconds is this? (Often displayed in metric units like litres for drinks)
questions.explanation: Convert to minutes first: 2 hours = 120 minutes. Total = 120 + 45 = 165 minutes. Convert to seconds: 165 × 60 = 9900 seconds.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Complex time conversions metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Movie 2 hours 45 minutes, convert to seconds. Time calculation: 9900 seconds.

questions.question: A race timer shows 1 minute and 23.5 seconds. Convert this to milliseconds. (Athletes often measure weight in kilograms)
questions.explanation: Convert to seconds first: 1 minute = 60 seconds. Total = 60 + 23.5 = 83.5 seconds. Convert to milliseconds: 83.5 × 1000 = 83500 milliseconds.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Time conversions with milliseconds metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Race timer 1 minute 23.5 seconds, convert to milliseconds. Timer conversion: 83500 ms.

questions.question: A stopwatch shows 2.75 minutes. How many seconds is this? (Some stopwatches also display imperial units like feet)
questions.explanation: To convert minutes to seconds, multiply by 60 since there are 60 seconds in each minute. 2.75 × 60 = 165 seconds.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Time conversions minutes to seconds metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Stopwatch shows 2.75 minutes, convert to seconds. Time measurement: 165 seconds.

questions.question: A cooking timer is set for 45 minutes. How many seconds is this?
questions.explanation: To convert minutes to seconds, multiply by 60 since there are 60 seconds in each minute. 45 × 60 = 2700 seconds.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Time conversions practical applications metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Cooking timer 45 minutes, convert to seconds. Kitchen timer: 2700 seconds.

questions.question: A recipe calls for 250 mL of milk. How many litres is this?
questions.explanation: To convert millilitres to litres, divide by 1000 since there are 1000 millilitres in one litre. 250 ÷ 1000 = 0.25 litres.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Volume conversions cooking applications metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Recipe needs 250 mL milk, convert to litres. Cooking measurement: 0.25 L.

questions.question: A fuel tank holds 65 litres. How many millilitres is this?
questions.explanation: To convert litres to millilitres, multiply by 1000 since there are 1000 millilitres in each litre. 65 × 1000 = 65000 mL.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Volume conversions fuel capacity metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Fuel tank holds 65 litres, convert to millilitres. Tank capacity: 65000 mL.

questions.question: A water bottle contains 750 mL. Express this as a fraction of a litre.
questions.explanation: To convert millilitres to litres, divide by 1000 since there are 1000 millilitres in one litre. 750 ÷ 1000 = 0.75 L, which equals 3/4 of a litre.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Volume conversions with fractions metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Water bottle 750 mL, express as fraction of litre. Volume fraction: 0.75 L.

questions.question: A swimming pool has a capacity of 1.5 m³. How many litres does it hold?
questions.explanation: To convert cubic metres to litres, multiply by 1000 since one cubic metre equals 1000 litres. This tank conversion: 1.5 × 1000 = 1500 litres.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Volume conversions cubic metres applications metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Swimming pool 1.5 m³ capacity, convert to litres. Pool volume: 1500 L.

questions.question: A marathon runner completes the race in 2 hours, 45 minutes, and 30 seconds. Convert this total time to milliseconds.
questions.explanation: Step 1: Convert each unit to seconds. 2 hours = 2 × 3600 = 7200 seconds, 45 minutes = 45 × 60 = 2700 seconds, 30 seconds = 30 seconds. Step 2: Add together: 7200 + 2700 + 30 = 9930 seconds. Step 3: Convert to milliseconds: 9930 × 1000 = 9,930,000 milliseconds.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Complex time conversions with multiple units metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Marathon runner 2h 45m 30s, convert to milliseconds for sports timer. Complex time conversion: 9,930,000 ms.

questions.question: A school track meet timer records a race time of 12.5 seconds. If the timer has millisecond precision, express this time in hours, minutes, seconds, and milliseconds format.
questions.explanation: Split the decimal: 12.5 seconds = 12 seconds + 0.5 seconds. Convert the decimal part to milliseconds: 0.5 seconds × 1000 = 500 milliseconds. Since 12.5 seconds is less than 1 minute (60 seconds), both hours and minutes are 0. Sports bottle timers often use this format.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Precision time conversions with multiple units metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Track race 12.5 seconds, express in hours/minutes/seconds/milliseconds. Precision timing: 0h 0m 12s 500ms.

questions.question: A game timer counts down from 3 minutes and 45 seconds. If the timer updates every 50 milliseconds, how many timer updates occur during the countdown?
questions.explanation: Step 1: Convert total countdown time to milliseconds. 3 minutes = 3 × 60 = 180 seconds, plus 45 seconds = 225 seconds total. Step 2: Convert to milliseconds: 225 × 1000 = 225,000 milliseconds. Step 3: Calculate number of updates: 225,000 ÷ 50 = 4500 timer updates. Game containers often display this information.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Complex time calculations with rates metric units
questions.contentForEmbedding: Game timer 3m 45s countdown, 50ms updates, how many updates? Timer calculation: 4500 updates.

questions.question: A container holds 2.5 gallons of liquid. If 1 gallon = 3.785 litres and 1 litre = 1000 mL, how many millilitres does the container hold?
questions.explanation: This requires a two-step conversion from imperial to metric units. Step 1: Convert gallons to litres: 2.5 gallons × 3.785 litres/gallon = 9.4625 litres. Step 2: Convert litres to millilitres: 9.4625 litres × 1000 mL/litre = 9462.5 mL.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.curriculumSubtopic: Multi-step imperial to metric conversions
questions.contentForEmbedding: Container tank 2.5 gallons, convert through litres to millilitres. Multi-step conversion: 9462.5 mL.
